list.name: Changes
list.comment:
feat: Implement workshop and user profile editing
This commit introduces significant new features and UI enhancements, primarily focused on enabling owners to edit their workshop and user profiles. It also includes a major redesign of the staff management table and registration forms.
### New Features
- **Edit Workshop Profile (`edit_profile_page.dart`)**: - A new screen allowing owners to update their workshop details, including name, photo, opening/closing times, operational days, and description. - Integrates with `ApiService` to persist changes via a `PUT /owners/workshops/{id}` endpoint. - Features an image picker for uploading a new workshop photo and time pickers for setting hours. - Allows toggling the workshop's "active" status.
- **Edit User Profile (`edit_user_screen.dart` & `profile_menu_card.dart`)**: - Adds a new "Edit Profil User" screen accessible from the profile page. - Provides a form for users to update their full name and username. - The email field is present but read-only. - The backend implementation for updating user data is noted as a future task.
### Refactoring and UI Enhancements
- **Staff Management UI (`staff_table.dart`)**: - The staff list has been completely redesigned with a modern, card-based table layout. - Introduces pagination with animated page transitions for better performance and UX with large staff lists. - Replaces separate edit/delete buttons with a `PopupMenuButton` (`more_vert` icon) for a cleaner action menu. - Improves the visual design of status badges and user avatars.
- **Report Widgets (`report_health_tile.dart` & `report_kpi_card.dart`)**: - The `ReportHealthTile` has been significantly redesigned into a modern KPI card, featuring a progress bar, trend indicator icon (up/down arrow), and more organized data presentation. - Responsive layout logic in `report_kpi_card.dart` and `report_pages.dart` has been fixed and simplified to ensure correct sizing on different screens.
- **Registration Forms (`register_step_*.dart`)**: - The multi-step registration process is now broken down into separate, reusable widget files: `RegisterStepOne`, `RegisterStepTwo`, and `RegisterStepThree`. - A new shared `RegisterTextField` widget is created to standardize input field styling and validation logic across the registration flow.
### Backend and State Management
- **`ApiService`**: - Adds `updateWorkshop` method to handle `PUT` requests with multipart/form-data for updating workshop details, including photo uploads. - Enhances `fetchOwnerEmployees` to support server-side pagination and search functionality.
- **`EmployeeProvider`**: - `fetchOwnerEmployees` now accepts `page` and `search` parameters to align with API updates.

task.summary:
chore: Clean up IDE-specific project files
This commit removes several JetBrains IDE (`.idea` directory) and project-specific (`.iml`) files that are typically not tracked in version control. The main change is the renaming of the `.iml` file to a generic `project.iml`.
Key changes: - Deleted `.idea/.gitignore`, `.idea/deviceManager.xml`, `.idea/caches/deviceStreaming.xml`, and `.idea/libraries/KotlinJavaRuntime.xml`. - Removed old `.iml` files (`bbi-hub-flutter-app.iml`, `bengkel_online_flutter.iml`) and run configurations. - Renamed the project's module file in `.idea/modules.xml` to `project.iml`.

chore: Clean up IDE-specific project files
This commit removes several JetBrains IDE (`.idea` directory) and project-specific (`.iml`) files that are typically not tracked in version control. The main change is the renaming of the `.iml` file to a generic `project.iml`.
Key changes: - Deleted `.idea/.gitignore`, `.idea/deviceManager.xml`, `.idea/caches/deviceStreaming.xml`, and `.idea/libraries/KotlinJavaRuntime.xml`. - Removed old `.iml` files (`bbi-hub-flutter-app.iml`, `bengkel_online_flutter.iml`) and run configurations. - Renamed the project's module file in `.idea/modules.xml` to `project.iml`.

feat: Implement service detail screen and enhance service model
This commit introduces the "Detail Pekerjaan" (Work Detail) screen and significantly enhances the data models and services related to service/work management. Users can now tap on a work item in the list to view its comprehensive details.
### New Features
- **Detail Work Screen (`detailWork.dart`)**: * A new screen that displays detailed information about a service, including customer data, vehicle information, work status, scheduling, mechanic assignment, spare parts used, and a full cost breakdown. * It fetches data by service ID using the `ServiceProvider`. * The UI is structured into modular panels for clarity (customer, vehicle, work details, cost, etc.). * Includes a progress bar to visualize the current status of the work.
### Model and Service Layer Enhancements
- **`ServiceModel` (`service.dart`)**: * Expanded to include more fields from the API, such as `mechanic`, a list of `items` (`TransactionItem`), `note`, and `categoryName`. * The `fromJson` factory is now more robust, handling variations in key names (e.g., `vehicle_id` vs. `vehicleId`) and safely parsing nested objects. * Added a `toJson` method for serialization and a `mechanicName` getter for easier UI display. * A new `MechanicRef` model was created to represent mechanic data.
- **`ApiService` (`api_service.dart`)**: * Added the `fetchServiceDetail(String id)` method to get data for a single service (`GET /owners/services/{id}`). * The `fetchServices` method is enhanced with more query parameters for server-side filtering (`workshopUuid`, `code`, `dateFrom`, `dateTo`). * API endpoints for services are now consistently routed to `/owners/services`.
- **`ServiceProvider` (`service_provider.dart`)**: * Added a `selected` property to hold the currently viewed `ServiceModel` for the detail page. * Implemented `fetchDetail(String id)` to call the new API service method and manage the state (`loading`, `selected`, `lastError`). * `fetchServices` now passes the `workshopUuid` to the API for more precise data fetching. * Improved the client-side search logic with flexible, safe accessors for nested data.
- **New `TransactionItem` Model (`transaction_item.dart`)**: * Created to model spare parts or other billable items associated with a service.
### UI/UX Improvements
- **`listWork.dart`**: * Work items (cards) are now tappable, navigating to the new `DetailWorkPage`. * The `workshopUuid` is now passed when fetching the service list to ensure only relevant data is shown. * The mechanic's name is now displayed on each work card, sourced from the updated `ServiceModel`.
### Project & IDE Files
- Added new JetBrains IDE configuration files (`deviceManager.xml`, `project.iml`, `workspace.xml`) to version control.

feat: Implement service detail screen and enhance service model
This commit introduces the "Detail Pekerjaan" (Work Detail) screen and significantly enhances the data models and services related to service/work management. Users can now tap on a work item in the list to view its comprehensive details.
### New Features
- **Detail Work Screen (`detailWork.dart`)**: * A new screen that displays detailed information about a service, including customer data, vehicle information, work status, scheduling, mechanic assignment, spare parts used, and a full cost breakdown. * It fetches data by service ID using the `ServiceProvider`. * The UI is structured into modular panels for clarity (customer, vehicle, work details, cost, etc.). * Includes a progress bar to visualize the current status of the work.
### Model and Service Layer Enhancements
- **`ServiceModel` (`service.dart`)**: * Expanded to include more fields from the API, such as `mechanic`, a list of `items` (`TransactionItem`), `note`, and `categoryName`. * The `fromJson` factory is now more robust, handling variations in key names (e.g., `vehicle_id` vs. `vehicleId`) and safely parsing nested objects. * Added a `toJson` method for serialization and a `mechanicName` getter for easier UI display. * A new `MechanicRef` model was created to represent mechanic data.
- **`ApiService` (`api_service.dart`)**: * Added the `fetchServiceDetail(String id)` method to get data for a single service (`GET /owners/services/{id}`). * The `fetchServices` method is enhanced with more query parameters for server-side filtering (`workshopUuid`, `code`, `dateFrom`, `dateTo`). * API endpoints for services are now consistently routed to `/owners/services`.
- **`ServiceProvider` (`service_provider.dart`)**: * Added a `selected` property to hold the currently viewed `ServiceModel` for the detail page. * Implemented `fetchDetail(String id)` to call the new API service method and manage the state (`loading`, `selected`, `lastError`). * `fetchServices` now passes the `workshopUuid` to the API for more precise data fetching. * Improved the client-side search logic with flexible, safe accessors for nested data.
- **New `TransactionItem` Model (`transaction_item.dart`)**: * Created to model spare parts or other billable items associated with a service.
### UI/UX Improvements
- **`listWork.dart`**: * Work items (cards) are now tappable, navigating to the new `DetailWorkPage`. * The `workshopUuid` is now passed when fetching the service list to ensure only relevant data is shown. * The mechanic's name is now displayed on each work card, sourced from the updated `ServiceModel`.
### Project & IDE Files
- Added new JetBrains IDE configuration files (`deviceManager.xml`, `project.iml`, `workspace.xml`) to version control.

refactor: Enhance service detail UI and data models
This commit introduces significant refactoring and enhancements to the service detail screen (`detailWork.dart`), related data models, and the voucher creation flow for improved data accuracy, robustness, and a cleaner user experience.
### Key Changes:
* **Service Detail Screen (`detailWork.dart`):** * **UI and Data Refinement**: The screen has been heavily refactored for clarity and to display more complete data from the backend, including estimated finish time, mechanic's name, and more detailed vehicle information. * **Robust Data Handling**: Replaced dynamic/unsafe data access with strongly-typed `Vehicle` and `Customer` models, ensuring no crashes from missing or malformed data. * **Conditional Logic**: Added logic to display status-aware messages, such as for the spare parts section (e.g., "Belum bisa mengisi sparepart..."). * **Code Cleanup**: Removed numerous `FIX:` comments, simplified widget structures, and improved code readability.
* **Voucher Creation (`voucher_previewpage.dart`):** * **Reliable Workshop ID**: The logic for fetching the `workshop_uuid` is now robust. It uses a new `user.workshopUuid` getter, which reliably finds the ID from either the owner's workshop list or their employment record, preventing `null` errors during voucher creation. * **Improved Error Handling**: Error messages shown to the user are now cleaner and more informative.
* **Data Model Enhancements:** * **`User` Model (`user.dart`):** Added a `workshopUuid` getter to provide a single, reliable way to access the user's associated workshop ID. * **`ServiceModel` (`service.dart`):** Greatly expanded to include more fields from the API like `acceptanceStatus`, `acceptedAt`, `completedAt`, and `feedbackMechanic`. The `fromJson` factory is now more resilient. * **`Vehicle` Model (`vehicle.dart`):** Expanded to include `year`, `color`, and `odometer`, with safe parsing. * **`Customer` Model (`customer.dart`):** Added an `address` field. * **`TransactionItem` Model (`transaction_item.dart`):** Hardened with safe parsers for numbers and quantities to prevent crashes from invalid data types.
* **General Code Quality:** * Numerous small cleanups and optimizations have been applied across the affected files to improve consistency and maintainability.

* **Voucher Creation (`voucher_previewpage.dart`):** * **Reliable Workshop ID**: The logic for fetching the `workshop_uuid` is now robust. It uses a new `user.workshopUuid` getter, which reliably finds the ID from either the owner's workshop list or their employment record, preventing `null` errors during voucher creation. * **Improved Error Handling**: Error messages shown to the user are now cleaner and more informative.
* **Data Model Enhancements:** * **`User` Model (`user.dart`):** Added a `workshopUuid` getter to provide a single, reliable way to access the user's associated workshop ID. * **`ServiceModel` (`service.dart`):** Greatly expanded to include more fields from the API like `acceptanceStatus`, `acceptedAt`, `completedAt`, and `feedbackMechanic`. The `fromJson` factory is now more resilient. * **`Vehicle` Model (`vehicle.dart`):** Expanded to include `year`, `color`, and `odometer`, with safe parsing. * **`Customer` Model (`customer.dart`):** Added an `address` field. * **`TransactionItem` Model (`transaction_item.dart`):** Hardened with safe parsers for numbers and quantities to prevent crashes from invalid data types.
* **General Code Quality:** * Numerous small cleanups and optimizations have been applied across the affected files to improve consistency and maintainability.

refactor(owner): Redesign report and staff management screens
This commit refactors the "Laporan" (Report) and "Manajemen Karyawan" (Staff Management) screens with a focus on UI consistency, code cleanup, and improved navigation.
### Key Changes:
* **Report Screen (`reportPages.dart`):** * **UI Overhaul**: The entire screen has been redesigned for a cleaner, more modern look with better spacing and component structure. The code has been significantly refactored for readability. * **Navigation**: The hardcoded back button has been replaced with a standard `SliverAppBar` leading action that only appears if navigation is possible (i.e., `Navigator.canPop()`). * **Code Cleanup**: Removed the unused `main()` function and streamlined widget implementations.
* **Staff Management Screen (`staffManagement.dart`):** * **Header Redesign**: The screen now uses a `SliverAppBar` similar to the report page for a consistent look and feel, removing the custom back button logic. The header content is now centered and simplified. * **UI Polish**: The "Quick Actions" card has rounded corners, and overall padding and spacing have been adjusted for a better layout. * **Code Cleanup**: Removed commented-out code and dead logic related to fetching `workshopUuid` from the auth provider.
* **`CustomHeader` Widget Removal:** * The reusable `CustomHeader` widget (`custom_header.dart`) has been deleted, as its functionality is now directly and more flexibly implemented within the screens using `SliverAppBar`.

* **`CustomHeader` Widget Removal:** * The reusable `CustomHeader` widget (`custom_header.dart`) has been deleted, as its functionality is now directly and more flexibly implemented within the screens using `SliverAppBar`.

chore: Clean up IDE-specific project files
This commit removes several JetBrains IDE (`.idea` directory) and project-specific (`.iml`) files that are typically not tracked in version control. The main change is the renaming of the `.iml` file to a generic `project.iml`.
Key changes: - Deleted `.idea/.gitignore`, `.idea/deviceManager.xml`, `.idea/caches/deviceStreaming.xml`, and `.idea/libraries/KotlinJavaRuntime.xml`. - Removed old `.iml` files (`bbi-hub-flutter-app.iml`, `bengkel_online_flutter.iml`) and run configurations. - Renamed the project's module file in `.idea/modules.xml` to `project.iml`.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
feat: Implement workshop and user profile editing
This commit introduces significant new features and UI enhancements, primarily focused on enabling owners to edit their workshop and user profiles. It also includes a major redesign of the staff management table and registration forms.
### New Features
- **Edit Workshop Profile (`edit_profile_page.dart`)**: - A new screen allowing owners to update their workshop details, including name, photo, opening/closing times, operational days, and description. - Integrates with `ApiService` to persist changes via a `PUT /owners/workshops/{id}` endpoint. - Features an image picker for uploading a new workshop photo and time pickers for setting hours. - Allows toggling the workshop's "active" status.

### Refactoring and UI Enhancements
- **Staff Management UI (`staff_table.dart`)**: - The staff list has been completely redesigned with a modern, card-based table layout. - Introduces pagination with animated page transitions for better performance and UX with large staff lists. - Replaces separate edit/delete buttons with a `PopupMenuButton` (`more_vert` icon) for a cleaner action menu. - Improves the visual design of status badges and user avatars.
- **Report Widgets (`report_health_tile.dart` & `report_kpi_card.dart`)**: - The `ReportHealthTile` has been significantly redesigned into a modern KPI card, featuring a progress bar, trend indicator icon (up/down arrow), and more organized data presentation. - Responsive layout logic in `report_kpi_card.dart` and `report_pages.dart` has been fixed and simplified to ensure correct sizing on different screens.
- **Registration Forms (`register_step_*.dart`)**: - The multi-step registration process is now broken down into separate, reusable widget files: `RegisterStepOne`, `RegisterStepTwo`, and `RegisterStepThree`. - A new shared `RegisterTextField` widget is created to standardize input field styling and validation logic across the registration flow.
### Backend and State Management
- **`ApiService`**: - Adds `updateWorkshop` method to handle `PUT` requests with multipart/form-data for updating workshop details, including photo uploads. - Enhances `fetchOwnerEmployees` to support server-side pagination and search functionality.
- **`EmployeeProvider`**: - `fetchOwnerEmployees` now accepts `page` and `search` parameters to align with API updates.
